review.comment_positive: This is a perfectly good small hotel in Can Tho if you just need a functional base for a day or 2. the staff are pleasant and speak enough English to get by. The rooms have modern touches such as automatic curtain opening and light switches which are nice. Its a 5 minute walk to the Ninh Quay with all the food stalls and market and where to get the boats to Cai Rang. If you just need a cheap and functional base itâ€™s fine. For our 2 nights stay to see the floating markets we didnâ€™t need a pool or anything more fancy.
review.comment_negative: The shower leaked and the room whilst surface clean doesnâ€™t appear to be deep cleaned as there were copious cobwebs and when you look closely at the walls and corners they are a bit tatty and dusty. The balcony chairs donâ€™t have seat cushions so are pretty uncomfortable. They make you sign a form at check in saying you wonâ€™t bring smelly durian fruit or similar into the room - probably more aimed at Asian guests which the hotel primarily seems to cater for ( the breakfast is entirely Asian ) or they will charge you 100% extra. Fair as the smell of durian is awful and lingers for ages but weird!!

review.comment_positive: Room was clean. Very comfortable bed.
review.comment_negative:
When I checked in I was told the entire hotel was out of power until the evening. If the hotel had contacted me in advance, I would have adjusted my time and checked in after the power was restored. 
After check-in, I asked for a room change or an early check-in for my next reservation, but both were refused on the grounds that the hotel was fully booked. However, I was told that at breakfast, there were not many guests staying and it would be by order only but not buffet. I don't know which is true, but the receptionist didn't seem to want to do anything about it and immediately answered that the hotel was fully booked, which I didn't feel right about.
Breakfast was simple, not much compared to other hotels in the same class, and there were few choices.
The shower temperature was not stable, and many times it suddenly became hot and almost scalding.
Overall, the reception was not very helpful, although I guess it depends on who is at the reception. (One person was very good though). If asked if I would stay there again, I probably would not.

review.rating: A very nice hotel centrally-located for a pleasant stay in Can Tho
review.comment_positive:
The KP hotel is nicely situated very near the Can Tho boat pier, the central market area and also the night market, with numerous eating establishments in the local vicinity.

Apart from one initial disappointment, we found overall the KP hotel to be a superb establishment.

Our room was immaculately appointed and was very comfortable.

Breakfast was a buffet (or from an a-le-carte menu, if only a few guests were staying). The range of food was slightly biased to Far-East Asian tastes, though freshly cooked-to-order eggs were available for those preferring more Western style food.

The staff at this hotel are excellent - friendly, polite, eager to help, and very competent. Whether it be the conceige, reception, breakfast or housekeeping staff, they were all excellent, but we must highlight one member of staff- Jenny Mo - who worked wonders on our behalf. We presented Jenny with our 'little' problem of how to get from Can Tho to Ca Mau (a 4-hour drive by bus) and she said she could arrange everything for us. We returned to the hotel a couple of hours later to find everything arranged (including the bus company collecting us from our hotel) - well done, Jenny, your arrangements were to perfection.
review.comment_negative:
We had one initial shock and disappointment on first entering our allocated room - there was NO window - four nicely decorated walls, but no window!!! As we had just taken the last available room, we were unable to organise an upgrade to a windowed room. The norm these days is for the hotel to state that there would be no window either in the hotel description on the booking.com website, or when confirming a room booking. Neither occurred with our booking. Never-the-less, having overcome the initial disappointment of no window, we did enjoy our 3-day stay.

The was a very large modern electronic safety box in the room for our valuables, etc, and the room itself was protected by an electronic key card door lock. However this safety box was able to migrate about the room as it was not bolted to either the walls or the furniture. At least we didn't have to worry about the box expectedly falling out of our window!!!

review.comment_positive: ok

This hotel is very central in Can Tho.
On the upper end of the price range but very comfortable.
Our family suite is large, very modern, but it suffers from a lack of a proper wall.
The room is separated by partitions especially the family suites, and the partitions are no more than particle boards hence one can hear every minute conversations of your neighbors. 
Not much street noise aside from neighboring room noise, as such I used ear plugs.
Breakfast is good and because it has a restaurant, the coffee is excellent.
Staff is helpful although when booking tours, make sure to confirm proper prices.

review.comment_positive: The staff was great! We went early to Mekong Delta, therefor we would have skipped the breakfast, but the staff was willing to put some things aside for us, which was so thoughtful from them. The room was very clean, in a very good location - close to the centre, away from the main street. Our room had windows towards the street, but did not hear too much traffic inside. Bathroom had a lot of space and amazing shower. The AC worked very well and was quiet.
